intro: Taverniera spartea, commonly known as the Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features spiny, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its defensive adaptations. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Taverniera spartea is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
